alert.note: Alert for Nowata; Osage; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 22 at 10:00AM CST until December 22 at 10:15AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN OSAGE...WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN NOWATA COUNTIES... At 959 AM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 2 miles northeast of Tyro to 4 miles east of Dewey to near Ramona, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. Highway 75 between Ramona and the Kansas state line will be impacted. Locations impacted include... Bartlesville, Dewey, Barnsdall, South Coffeyville, Copan, Ramona, Ochelata, Delaware, Avant, Lenapah, Wann, Bartlesville Municipal Airport, Hulah, Osage Hills State Park, Okesa, Wah Sha She State Park, Tallant and Wolco. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
